title: WEDNESDAY 13 Drops New Music Video for Single, "In Misery"

author: Isabella Ambrosio
byline: By Isabella Ambrosio Published 4 hours ago

text: Wednesday 13 knows the music is campy – but that's half the fun. His newest single, "In Misery," saw the release of the accompanying music video on Thursday. The whimsical frontman's upcoming record, Mid Death Crisis, is due out on April 25th, with his North American There's No Such Thing As Monsters tour currently underway. The song is fun, and the accompanying record was dubbed by Wednesday 13 as a "leave-your-brain-at-the-door" rager. With 12 tracks, one featuring Faster Pussycat's Taime Downe, the record is chalk full of horror-inspired anthems. The current tour is celebrating 20 years of Wednesday 13's record Transylvania 90210 while showing off Murderdoll hits. Check out live dates below. You can preorder the record here. WEDNESDAY 13 with STITCHED UP HEART, DEAD RABBITS, and I YA TOYAH:3/28 — San Antonio, TX @ Paper Tiger3/29 — Dallas, TX @ Trees3/30 — Houston, TX @ Warehouse Live4/01 — Birmingham, AL @ Saturn4/02 — Knoxville, TN @ Open Chord4/04 — Atlanta, GA @ The Loft –Centerstage4/05 — Raleigh, NC @ Chapel Of Bones4/06 — Greenville, SC @ Radio Room4/08 — Baltimore, MD @ Zen West4/09 — Leesburg, VA @ Tally Ho4/10 — Sayreville, NJ @ Starland Ballroom4/12 — Hampton Beach, NH @ Wallys4/13 — Montreal, QC @ Foufounes Electrique4/15 — Toronto, ON @ Lee's Palace4/16 — Buffalo, NY @ Rec Room4/18 — New York, NY @ The Gramercy4/19 — Stroudsburg, PA @ Sherman Theater4/20 — Lititz, PA @ Mickey's Black Box4/22 — Pittsburgh, PA @ Crafthouse4/23 — Cleveland, OH @ Mercury4/25 — Columbus, OH @ The Kings Of Clubs4/26 — Flint, MI @ Machine Shop4/27 — Cadillac, MI @ Venue Event Center4/29 — Joliet, IL @ The Forge4/30 — Madison, WI @ The Annex5/2 — Denver, CO @ Oriental Theater5/3 — Colorado Springs, CO @ Black Sheep Want More Metal? html:
Wednesday 13 knows the music is campy – but that's half the fun. His newest single, "In Misery," saw the release of the accompanying music video on Thursday.

The whimsical frontman's upcoming record, Mid Death Crisis, is due out on April 25th, with his North American There's No Such Thing As Monsters tour currently underway.

The song is fun, and the accompanying record was dubbed by Wednesday 13 as a "leave-your-brain-at-the-door" rager. With 12 tracks, one featuring Faster Pussycat's Taime Downe, the record is chalk full of horror-inspired anthems.

The current tour is celebrating 20 years of Wednesday 13's record Transylvania 90210 while showing off Murderdoll hits. Check out live dates below.

You can preorder the record here.

WEDNESDAY 13 with STITCHED UP HEART, DEAD RABBITS, and I YA TOYAH:
